data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: A New Class of Metal-Cyclam-Based Zirconium Metal–Organic Frameworks for CO2 Adsorption and Chemical Fixation

data.question: What are the names of the two new robust 3D porous metal-cyclam-based zirconium MOFs mentioned?
What is the main challenge in designing MOFs for catalysis according to the article?
data.answer: Rationally designing and constructing MOFs that can serve as highly stable and reusable heterogeneous catalysts

data.question: What is the CO2 uptake capacity of VPI-100 MOFs at 273 K under 1 atm?
True or False: VPI-100 MOFs demonstrate catalytic activity for the chemical fixation of CO2 with epoxides.
What is the role of the cyclam core in the VPI-100 MOFs?
data.answer: The cyclam core has accessible axial coordination sites for guest interactions and maintains the electronic properties exhibited by the parent cyclam ring.

data.question: True or False: VPI-100 MOFs are unstable in various organic and aqueous solvents.
What is the chemical stability range of VPI-100 MOFs?
data.answer: VPI-100 MOFs exhibit excellent chemical stability in various organic and aqueous solvents over a wide pH range.

data.question: What is the significance of the modulated synthetic strategy in the synthesis of VPI-100 MOFs?
data.answer: It was used to obtain highly crystalline MOF powders from the cyclam-based ligands.

data.question: True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs can be used as recoverable stable heterogeneous catalysts without losing performance.
What is the highest reported catalytic activity value (turnover frequency) among Zr-based MOFs for the chemical fixation of CO2 with epoxides?
data.answer: Some of the highest reported catalytic activity values (turnover frequency and conversion efficiency) among Zr-based MOFs for the chemical fixation of CO2 with epoxides.

data.question: True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs bear dual catalytic sites (Zr and Cu/Ni) that enable chemistry not possible with the cyclam ligand under the same conditions.
What is the main advantage of using VPI-100 MOFs over the parent cyclam ligand for catalysis?
data.answer: The MOFs, which bear dual catalytic sites (Zr and Cu/Ni), enable chemistry not possible with the cyclam ligand under the same conditions.

data.question: True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs have shown promise in applications beyond catalysis, such as gas storage and separation.
What is the potential application of the products from CO2 cycloaddition reactions catalyzed by VPI-100 MOFs?
data.answer: The products of these transformations are organic cyclic carbonates, which are employed in several important applications, such as degreasers, polar aprotic solvents, and electrolytes in lithium ion batteries.

data.question: True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs are not suitable for post-synthetic modification due to their instability in organic solvents.
What is the role of formic acid in the synthesis of VPI-100 frameworks?
data.answer: Formic acid and acetic acid were found to be competent modulators, influencing the crystal nucleation and growth rate differently in Zr(IV)-based MOFs.

data.question: True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs can maintain crystallinity even after immersion into highly acidic mixtures for 24 hours.
What is the BET surface area of VPI-100 (Ni) after activation at 120 °C?
True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs exhibit a type I CO2 sorption isotherm, characteristic of microporous materials.
